intro: Dendrocnide latifolia, commonly known as the stinging tree, is a shrub or small tree native to northeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes plants known for their stinging hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered with fine, irritating hairs that can cause severe dermatitis upon contact. The plant is well adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native range.
